title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review:
really boring 
uneven performance
combat and movement feels very floaty and imprecise
looks bad technically and dull aesthetically
intolerable dialogue

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review: Really fun game, no complaints. Plays like the newer God of War games mixed with a pinch of Souls. Not nearly as hard as Souls games with a much more comprehensible story. Really enjoyed this, doesn't overstay its welcome either.

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review: Fun gameplay. Great settings. Awesome enemies. Not enough bosses. Main character doesn't feel compelling enough - they could have focused more on her being more likeable. Nevertheless a good game with lots of fun.

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review: Pretty bad pacing issues, both with story and level presentation, but the overall gameplay is enjoyable. Parrying feels good and the boss fights were really fun. I do however, wish that there were more boss fights, and also less filler/exploration time between them. I didn't feel enticed to engage with pretty much any of the side content. (7/10)

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review: Has it's shortcomings, but overall fun/satisfying combat with great voice acting. Did have a few game crashes, but loading back in was fast. Game did feel short. Could benefit from NG+. Overall would recommend. Good for a AA game.

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review:
31/38 achievements, 81%. 13 hours total playtime.

Got bad reviews from others, but I think it's a solid souls-like entry. I wish the story was more fleshed out, but I did enjoy the characters (+1 for Adam Jensen VA being in it).
Combat was solid, fun, never got old/boring for me.

Did crash 3-4 times.
4070, i5 12600k, never dropped below 90 FPS on max settings, everything highest it could be, 1440p. 

Altogether, would recommend. (also, if you hate platforming/exploration, do not buy this game).

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review: Short game and not much in terms of weapon variety but, the controls are tight and world map is nothing to scoff at I had a blast and hope more people will give this game a actual shot.

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review:
Disregarding its controversy, the game isn't actually bad.

There are aspects to the combat, gameplay, and world-building that should be commended, but quest-ending glitches and some graphical pop-ins do diminish the overall experience.

Personally, I try to look for a game's positives more than its weaknesses, so I'd say Flintlock is a solid 6.5/10.

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review:
Fantastic game. Easy 9/10
Some minor audio and performance issues here and there but overall highly recommended.

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review:
Sifu, Ashen 都是A44有創意的GOOD GAME, 但這遊戲沒有那種驚喜
地圖感覺空蕩蕩, 沒有很多互動元素, 有點感覺未開發完(但也沒有不認真的地方), 但沒有法環那樣空

戰鬥:
戰鬥感覺得有點似戰神但比戰神OP(也沒有很易)而多樣, 也沒有耐力限制...
有完美擋格,  完美閃避
應該的都有

長度:
比一般長遠(超過30小時), 最高難度

價錢:
超值! 即使原價也是

難度:
沒有打過魂類的人應該會受不了, 特別是最後王

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review: Quintessential good-but-not-quite-great AA effort, lots of character and promise, very fun combat. Would LOVE to see what the devs could do with a sequel, but happy with what we've got.

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review:
Straight-forward action adventure with soulslite elements. 
[7/10]

+ unique fantasy setting
+ fast-paced tactical combat with a smooth hybrid fighting style
+ fun casual platforming puzzles
+ rewarding exploration in adequate level design
– low variety in build options and enemies
– protagonist has superficial thoughts and dialogues
– mediocre to decent voice acting with a tons of forgetful characters
– boring narrative and script with shallow quests

For this price it offers more fun gameplay than most AAA games, while being equally shallow.

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review: I found this a very approachable game as someone with no soulslike experience. Combat is interesting and requires you to pay attention to animations and mechanics without ever feeling unfair or crushingly difficult. Checkpoints are plentiful, upgrades feel useful, and the game is short enough that I didn't get sick of any of the side content. It's not a life-changing game but it was enjoyable and worthwhile for me.

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review:
This game has made me realize that reviewers are too finicky, too demanding, and overly spoiled by today’s standards that no game ever achieves excellence in. I am so disappointed in the reviewers. I read them, I waited to get the game, got it on sale and it is just a great and fun game. 

In a period of time when AAA games are failing us in performance like dragons dogma 2 this game outperforms. In a period of time where AAA games like Skull and Bones gameplay misses the mark this game out performs. In a period of time where AAA games have an absolutely terrible story and set of characters like Forespoken this game out performs. It’s fine to call it a AA B rated game. That’s ok, but it’s top class AA where it out shines many AAA games. These devs deserve support. Thank you for this game.

And for Lenovo Go users, I run it at 1200p at high settings and it runs amazing.

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review:
The good:

- Art and design
- Fighting system
- Locations

The bad:

- After the first half the game feels rushed. Final level has gorgeous aesthetics, but the mobs are from the first level?!
- Very limited items. I had only two hatchets throughout the whole game
- Story is mediocre at best

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review: This is a great game. feel bad that it got bad press because its one of my favorite games of the year.hope more people get to enjoy  it.

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn offers a thrilling experience with its fast-paced movement mechanics and challenging difficulty options, but it suffers from obstructive invisible walls that hinder exploration. The mantling system is often finicky, with minor bumps halting your progress, and while the story is decent and town conversations are entertaining, repetitive and annoying voice lines like "What's that then" can quickly wear thin. Overall, the game’s engaging combat and lively dialogue are overshadowed by frustrating movement issues and a lack of fluid exploration. Still worth playing, but there are definitely better options out there. Try Ashen if you haven't.

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review:
Upvoted the game but it has issues. 
1 - phantom walls that block you from taking a short cut across the map are annoying. You MUST find a specific route to get to some places even though I found a way to get there faster.
2 - What's the point of saying I can survive large falls if I do a double jump right before I hit the ground, if you're going to say I died when I jump off a ledge that the game deems "too far"? rhetorical..it's not fair to the gamer.
3 - Why have areas mapped out on the map I can never go to? It's like they never finished the game or removed things to have it later as DLC. They might be in those areas. Islands and map areas near the outer edge seem to have things to do but I can't get to them. I searched and searched for doorways or access points and nothing. Sometimes it forces you to use the skull jump points or you can't get places.  
4 - DO NOT go to the last (3rd) map travel area to go after Uru until you're sure you're ready. I passed/activated a ton of load stones and when I got to Uru's area, I tried to go back to the camp and it said i'ts disabled??? I have unfinished side quests I can never do.
BTW once you fight Uru, the game just ends. You can't go back and finish side quests.
The graphics and gameplay overall are great though. I used an unlimited potions cheat and had fun with it because it also applies to grenades. You can then throw as many as you like. 
It really does look good and plays fine but it has annoyances and things players need to know like, make sure you find everything in side quests before leaving an area to travel. This only applies to people who want to find all the hidden stuff and side quests. 
Why are there like 20 slots for guns, grenades, etc etc and there appears to be very few of them. I found a whole 3 helmets. I assume all the other armor set items are in those hidden map areas. I tried to upgrade one axe but it said I didn't have one rare resource. I never saw that resource anywhere. 
It was still fun to play.

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review:
Reviewing as definitely-not-a-souls-like-gamer: Flintlock (on normal) is challenging, but managable and very enjoyable experience. I absolutely love platforming and movement system. Exploration feels rewarding. Good environmental storytelling skeletons.

I feel a lot of sympathy for both Nor and Enki, who is such a good companion - with his abilities, personality, and amazing animations. Also voice acting is truly fantastic for both of them.

So my only complain would be that game was sometimes dropping frames in the second part of the game, *BUT* 1) my processor is worse than suggested one in minimum requirement 2) it worked on Ubuntu, so that's on me.
Also I wish it would has more options in photomode, cause capturing Nor and Venki was also very fun.

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review:
[h1] Sweet Baby Inc's best work yet. [/h1]

First things first: While Flintlock definitely has some soulslike trappings, mainly in the way it handles death, it is really just a fairly competent riff on God of War 2019 -- if Kratos had a double jump and an air dash. 
Yes, there's a parry and a dodge roll but there's no stamina bar you have to nurse and you can actually pause the game ;) 

While the combat doesn't feel especially good, the graphics aren't anything to write home about (except when they sometimes are) and the story is flimsy at best, this game just offers so many mechanics and they all tie together rather elegantly. Shooting, stabbing, throwing grenades, and magic are just a few ways you can dispatch enemies -- and the game actively encourages you to switch it up by upping your score multiplier, almost like it's Devil May Cry. 

So yes, the game is good. Some great loot, beautiful music and chill vistas -- for less than 30 bucks I paid it's more than worth it.

Now, I know, the question that's been burning on everyone's mind: is the game woke? 
Just kidding, I don't know. But you know what's certainly not woke? Touching grass.

7/10

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review:
Based on my experience so far, this game is quite impressive. It effectively combines several elements from the God of War series with the challenge characteristic of Dark Souls. However, it is important to note that it is not a fully Souls-like game. Playing on the hard difficulty, as I do, often results in being defeated in just 2 - 3 hits.

The combat system is fluid and enjoyable, with a seamless integration of both melee and ranged combat, which adds to the overall excitement. Additionally, the game features platforming elements that provide a refreshing break after intense combat sequences, however, it feels a little rushed sometimes.

At this point, i can recommend this game to anyone who enjoys Souls-like experiences or titles similar to God of War.


[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/44938427/]Check out my other reviews here[/url]

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review: Decent Soulslike. Very finicky with regards to parry timing, more difficult than the average Souls clone. Need to be very patient with it to get much out of it, but it's polished and enjoyable all things considered.

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review: Tunnel levels, terrible camera, terrible controls, unclear game mechanics.. No, thanks..

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review: I tried to like it but couldn't, this feels like Forspoken all over again. Personally its not my taste but Im sure many people will enjoy it.

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review: Not a very polished game to say the least, but the gameplay loop and the characters were really good. Music is incredible; especially the boss themes.

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review:
Just beat this. Had a good time. If you want a souls-lite with good mobility and can take a little jank, you won't go wrong here. The writing's good too (a handful of characters are just... there, but some get some more love).

From the middle on, you're basically a tank rolling over the poor undead, and only a few difficult encounters and the major bosses pose a real threat. Final boss is a real pain in the ass, but that's to be expected (also crashed my game twice while the entire rest of the game was stable).

Exploration is rewarding, combat abilities are fun, and the area design can be quite pretty. Yeah, give this a go!

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review: having fun on this game the skill tree is so good not bad but soo good to play

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review:
the fox does a big stretch and the trailer has dramatic classical music in it
11/10

in seriousness now i've played it more. Nor has a real issue with refusing to do things if she is already in an animation [dodging needs to be more of a priority than a random overhead swing babe] [same with firing a gun for attack interruptions]
but the gameplay is fun, engaging and the world/lore is gorgeous. It's a shame it never took off [also don't look at the community page, the weirdos hate this game] but i very much recommend

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review: This game have fun combat but  grindy boring achievement

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review:
Bought on sale and really enjoyed this game from start to finish.
I really appreciate that it's not too long, I think there are like 5 real bosses - but the devs avoided dragging the game out too long with filler bullshit. Fun risk/reward mechanics, feels like a hybrid of God of War and Souls-like (but not punishing), with more mobility, crafting isn't over-complicated (there are like 3 resource types), and you build up the skill tree at a consistent pace through the game.
Would buy again

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review: Great and non woke. Really. It really is! Fun time!

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review: Fun AA game.

title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
review: Dark souls meets god of war
